Test Scenario: Create a parent task with multiple subtasks
Prerequisites: Logged in as Leader or Admin; At least 2 team members available
Test Steps: 1. Click Create Task button; 2. Fill in parent task details (title/description/priority/due date); 3. In Subtasks section click Add Subtask; 4. Enter subtask title; 5. Select assignee for subtask; 6. Set subtask due date; 7. Add another subtask (optional); 8. Click Create Task
Expected Result: Task created with success message showing 'Task created with X subtasks'; Parent task appears in To Do column; Subtasks appear as separate cards with [Subtask] badge

Test Scenario: View subtasks within parent task modal
Prerequisites: A parent task with subtasks exists
Test Steps: 1. Navigate to Tasks page (Kanban Board); 2. Click on a parent task card; 3. Look for Subtasks section in modal
Expected Result: Task View Modal opens; Subtasks section displays all child subtasks; Each subtask shows title/assignee/progress/due date/status

Test Scenario: Update subtask progress as assigned user
Prerequisites: Logged in as user assigned to a subtask
Test Steps: 1. Navigate to Tasks page; 2. Click on your assigned subtask; 3. Click on progress bar to enable editing; 4. Drag slider to desired percentage (e.g. 50%); 5. Click checkmark to save
Expected Result: Progress updates successfully; Toast shows 'Progress set to X%'; Modal closes after saving; Kanban board shows updated progress; If 100% subtask moves to Completed

Prerequisites: Logged in as Member (not Leader); Assigned to a subtask
Test Steps: 1. Navigate to Tasks page; 2. Click on subtask assigned to you; 3. Try to set progress to 100%
Expected Result: Progress bar restricted to max 99%; Cannot set to 100% as Member; Only Task Creator or Leader can set 100%

Test Scenario: Subtasks appear on calendar with due dates
Test Steps: 1. Navigate to Calendar page; 2. Look for subtasks on their due dates; 3. Click on a subtask event
Expected Result: Subtasks appear on calendar with [Subtask] label; Event detail modal opens on click; Shows subtask details and parent task reference; View Task Details button opens full modal

Prerequisites: Logged in as Leader or Task Creator; A subtask exists
Test Steps: 1. Navigate to Tasks page; 2. Click on a subtask to open modal; 3. Click Edit button; 4. Modify subtask title or due date; 5. Save changes
Expected Result: Edit form opens; Can modify subtask details; Changes saved successfully; Updated information reflects immediately

Test Scenario: Delete a subtask from parent task
Prerequisites: Logged in as Leader or Task Creator; A subtask exists
Test Steps: 1. Navigate to Tasks page; 2. Click on a subtask; 3. Click Edit then Delete option; 4. Confirm deletion
Expected Result: Confirmation dialog appears; Subtask removed on confirm; No longer appears on Kanban or Calendar; Parent task subtask count updates

Prerequisites: Ability to create subtasks and assign to others
Test Steps: 1. As Leader create task with subtask; 2. Assign subtask to a Member; 3. Login as the assigned Member; 4. Check notifications
Expected Result: Assigned user receives notification; Shows 'New Subtask Assigned'; Message includes subtask and parent task title; Clicking notification navigates to subtask

Prerequisites: Subtasks exist in the Kanban board
Test Steps: 1. Navigate to Tasks page (Kanban Board); 2. Find a subtask in To Do column; 3. Drag subtask card to In Progress column; 4. Release the card
Expected Result: Subtask moves to new column; Status updates automatically; Progress updates based on column; Success feedback shown

Test Scenario: Parent task progress calculated from subtasks
Test Steps: 1. Create parent task with 3 subtasks; 2. Set Subtask 1 progress to 100%; 3. Set Subtask 2 progress to 50%; 4. Set Subtask 3 progress to 0%; 5. View parent task progress
Expected Result: Parent task progress reflects average of subtasks; Expected: (100+50+0)/3 = ~50%; Parent progress bar shows approximately 50%; Updates when subtask progress changes

Test Steps: 1. Navigate to Tasks page; 2. Use search bar to search subtask title; 3. Use filters to filter by assignee
Expected Result: Subtasks appear in search results; Filters apply to both tasks and subtasks; Matching subtasks displayed correctly
